title: BEEF EMPANADAS
directions: Place the chopped up potatoes and raisins in a medium sized pot covered in water and bring water to a boil. Let boil for 5 minutes, then reduce heat and simmer for about 45 minutes or until potatoes are soft. Midway trough add the 5-7 whole eggs to boil and add more water if needed.
Chop the 2 onions and olives finely, and add to large skillet with olive oil and saute in medium heat
Chop garlic and peppers as finely as possible, then blend together. Add mix to onions and saute until onions are soft and translucent.
Add the Ground Beef to the vegetable mix. Once mixed, add oregano, salt and pepper, beef stock cube, tomato sauce, and badia seasoning to the meat and mix until spread evenly.
Add a cup of water and bring it to a boil, then lower heat and let meat cook.
Drain the potato mixture. Shell and chop the eggs
Once meat is browned, add potatoes, raisins, and eggs. Stir to combine.
Let the mixture cook on medium heat until most of the water has evaporated.
ingredients: 6-8 cloves garlic (blended or chopped extra fine)
1 small green pepper (chopped extra fine or blended)
1 beef stock cube crushed to dust
